Flamenco

This one-legged pink chum spends its whole day jumping around on its singular foot. With no opposable thumbs nor opposable wings, the only means of travel is hopping, and the only means of attacking prey is pecking. God has forsaken this chum as rather useless, as such it shall spend its days hopping around in search of more things to throw its head into.
Stump

This wooden chum was once part of a local tree, until a quite rude lumberjack decided that ol' stumpy didn't need its family anymore. These days it spends its time attacking anything unfamiliar with its signature spin attack.
Pear
Lurking in the shadows, and waiting for more prey is a chum with a very pointy stick. It may be slow, but golly gosh, that stick works wonders. Those wonders being inflicting a lot of pain.
Jabby

No one is really sure where this chum comes from. It seems a little out of place a lot of the time and its very unclear which direction its looking, without eyes and all. With its tail it goes jabby-jab in quick succession.
Slate

An old log that has harnessed the modern technologies of the catapult, allowing it to conjure rocks from nowhere and hurl them some distance. It's a tough job though, since this chum has little health and those rocks can also conjure a bit of hatred when hitting one's head.
Healio
Such a thoughtful and kind chum. Whenever an enemy chum is defeated, this little flower will send a helping hand by healing friends who need it.
Ring of Pearls
Down on your luck with a low amount of friendship bracelets? Fear not, behold this flower which grants you an extra bracelet on every enemy defeat!
Bolt

Just a silly little guy! With no defense mechanisms, it seems Evolution should have forgotten it long ago. Although, Bolt will distract enemies attention 80% of the time! It may also give up some secrets if it is smacked.
Fan
Huge fan of this one.
Floaty
Some say Floaty evolved from a highly sophistocated security system that decided to start shooting everything on sight. Seems a bit far fetched though, right?
Melly
Portable Melatonin! This little antennae friend doesn't do much by itself, however when defeated it lets out a burst of sleepyness, causing enemy chums to fall back asleep for a short while.
Ram
Just a cute waddling strange creature until it approaches you and rams into your shins with the power of a thousand suns. Won't be laughing then...
Leapy
This chum was given springy legs to jump around with, along with fists that deal one hell of a punch.
Clop
One eyed one horned flying purple people eater. But doesnt fly, isnt purple and doesnt often eat people.
Medusa
Like an record.
Basalt
Sends its love when an enemy chum is defeated in the form of a flaming hot molten rock.
Prisoner
** NO RECORDS FOUND **
Prisoner
** NO RECORDS FOUND **
Prisoner
** NO RECORDS FOUND **
Prisoner
** NO RECORDS FOUND **
Charles
This wooden chum once spent it's days attacking anything unfamiliar with its signature spin attack, but was then rudely moved to a new home where it promptly burned alive.
Ashi
Just a cute pup.
Globe
Designed after the world itself. After several attempts, the satellites were deemed necessary for survival.
Buzz
Buzz buzz, and such.
Hive

Even more buzz buzz, and such. The such involves a family of Buzz that will stop at nothing to protect their home. They better hope all their siblings showed up, as the Buzz from a Hive wont handle being outside for long!
Granite

Such a studious flower. If flowers can be studious? This one has learned the ins and outs of all other chums, and upon defeat of an enemy, will occasionally up the ante and increase a friend's quality with a mysterious floating purple orb, for the cost of some of health. Provided that friend has no damage.
Marble
One of the first chums, bringing life to others. Upon enemy defeat, there is a chance a friend's maximum health will be increased.
Echo
A long lost relic of what was to come. All this chum knows is how to throw a spear, over and over. If only it knew what it could accomplish by putting a bit more effort into thinking.
Ember
TODO
Goblet
TODO
How many have there been now? Hundreds? Thousands? I can't quite remember...
Yet I have found solace in this futility. A kind of meditation. This will be my life now.
This surely cannot be possible. Twenty five times and twenty five catastrophes...
I do not know how many they are willing to try, I have little hope.
I have seen the one that runs, it shows interesting properties...
With a keen sense of direction, it may not be able to help itself but perhaps others?
We have been instructed to vary the tests. Perhaps a change in scenery will offer a solution...
Yet I see no significant changes, in the end, all is to perish.
Perhaps we are to be the ones moving on, with the impossibility of unapproved death, there shall be many catastrophes to come...
However where is the value in a life that never ends?
They sometimes show promise these days, but it has become more of an entertainment, betting on the limited time until catastrophe...
Yet, the inevitability reigns and our one shortcoming is revealed.
Some of us have been imprisoned, it seems we are to be locked in this cycle without complaining or suggesting improvements...
We fear the cages.
The imprisoned ones brought a fresh light, new ideas, possible solutions...
But we do not know where they are now. Above all else, I hope they return.
This one may show the greatest potential of all...
We remain cautiously optimistic.
Yet again, we are shown what was inevitable from the beginning...
We are close to giving up.
They have the pools, the statues, the means of working together, but nothing works...
The pursuit of our new world's utopia seems more and more futile.
Many of the records are lost now. Some due to time, some seemingly on purpose. We are left repeating our own mistakes, blindly reaching for a miracle.
What have we tried before? What worked? What didn't?
We are all that remains now. It has gone and left us in this infinite cycle of injustice...
What are we working towards now?
Now on our own, we create the uncaging statues, in hope of their return...
They may truly be the only ones to end the cycle now.
Without direction, we change tactics. To create something to finish this for us...
Is it possible?
They must be sentient, with intelligence beyond the rest...
To complete the goal, and let us rest.
Jump!
Use [img]res://materials/ui/ui_jump.tres[/img] to scale looming cliffs.
Camera!

You can also use [img]res://materials/ui/ui_cam_left.tres[/img] & [img]res://materials/ui/ui_cam_right.tres[/img] along with [img]res://materials/ui/ui_cam_up.tres[/img] & [img]res://materials/ui/ui_cam_down.tres[/img] to help navigate better!
Bracelets!
Use [img]res://materials/ui/ui_attack.tres[/img] to retreive friendship bracelets. These can normally only be obtained from chums.
Bracelets!
When an enemy chum is knocked down, they will drop a bracelet for you!
Chums!
Use [img]res://materials/ui/ui_interact.tres[/img] to make best friends with knocked down chums! (For a cost of friendship bracelets...)
Bracelets!
Stronger chums will require more bracelets, but if a friend is knocked down, its cost of revival will never change!
Carry!
Use [img]res://materials/ui/ui_interact.tres[/img] to bring your friends with you!
Carry!
Between rooms, they will automatically follow you.
Battle!
Use [img]res://materials/ui/ui_attack.tres[/img] to ring the bell and wake enemy chums then battle for glory! You can hold [img]res://materials/ui/ui_attack.tres[/img] to wind up for a bigger smack!
Placement!
Make sure to strategically place your chums before battle for a higher chance of survival!
Too Crowded?
Use [img]res://materials/ui/ui_cycle.tres[/img] to cycle between chum information if there are too many close by!
Information!
You can use [img]res://materials/ui/ui_rotate.tres[/img] to view information about each chum on the back of their popup!
Need A Break?
Use [img]res://materials/ui/ui_pause.tres[/img] to take a breather!
Be Careful!
If you quit during a fight, you will die.
When we started this, I truly beleived in it. In the ways of our God, and in the ways of testing.
After our world's collapse, we had to try. To synthesise the perfect ecosystem, the perfect creatures. We wanted to rid them of pain and end.
As the trials went on, and the trashed realities piled up, I started to lose hope. We all did.
They were given so much. Means to better themselves, to travel, and to improve their health.
After nothing worked, some suggested setting alternate goals, ours were impossible as no creature can be perfect. Even us, it seems.
The rebels were imprisoned, and sent away. To where, I do not know. I do not even remember how many cycles have passed since then.
Soon after, I lost hope too. I dared not share this, but I continued, as a sort of slave.
I was not even surprised when our God left us. I would have done the same. Whether it was out of boredom, or loss of hope, I am unsure.
I sometimes pondered searching for them, to learn and to change our ways. Every time, I did nothing.
Then you were created. After many iterations, you developed something - traits beyond the other creatures. Not only did you survive, you did so much more.
You found them. I thank you for that. Perhaps they will help us afterall.
Do what you will. I have spent far too long here. This world is yours now.
